definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: He always bragged about1 his strength.
sentences.chinese: 他總是吹噓自己力大無比。

sentences.english: His brawny strength is evident from his big muscles.
sentences.chinese: 瞧他那肌肉的塊頭就知道他力大無比。

sentences.english: Herculean ya up two main effect.
sentences.chinese: 力大無比的二丫起了主要效果。

sentences.english: The boy is of extraordinary strength.
I have a strong throwing arm!
Gaff possessed powerful strength in his slim form, and could leap amazing distances.
sentences.chinese: 加夫雖然體形瘦削，但力大無比，其彈跳力更是驚人。
